- According to the distribution of the texts, the Gädlä ḥawaryat ofQQM-005would belong to the I recension’s group (cp. BauGaH, 83-84).
Text I-3, the Martyrdom pf St. Peter, does not contain the "Discourse of Peter on the Cross" (= BConAp I, 45-49; BConAp II, 30-34).
- The work ends with the subscriptio (fol. 142vb):

ተፈጸመ፡ በዝየ፡ ገድል፡ ዘ፲ወ፪፡ ሓዋርያት፡ ጸሎቶሙ፡ ትዕቀበነ፡ ለዘጸሐፋ፡ ወለአጽሐፋ፡ ለዘአንበባ፡ ለዓለም፡ አሜን፡, “Herewith the (the book of the) Vitae of the twelve Apostles has been completed. May their prayer protect us, the ones who wrote and the ones who caused to write and the one who recited it. Forever. Amen”.
The subscriptio is separated from the main text with black and red dots connected with dashes, and is followed by the same sign.
- Other subscriptiones are in fol. 143rab; see below Additiones 2-3.
- The scribe did not use the bottom ruled line, e.g., in fols. 15v, 22v-23r, 31v-32rv, 35r, 75rv.
- Each text, as well the additional notes after it, is separated by the previous one by a chain of red and black dots and/or a chain of black and red dots and dashes.

supportDesc.condition: The Ms. was rebound. The original sewing of the quires is missing; most of the quires are reinforced with parchment guards, on the spinefolds or in the centrefols of the quires. The majority of the leaves are affected by humidity at the upper and the bottom edges (esp. the last leaves). Small holes are in several leaves; the last folio is cut at the bottom.

handDesc.handNote: Mediocre Black; red (vermilion). Zena GäbrǝʾelZena Gäbrǝʾel is mentioned as the scribe in Additio 2. The handwriting is similar to that of Ms. ATH-001.Mid- 15th to mid 16th century (?)
The handwriting is upright to slightly left-sloping. Some letters tend to rounded and curved shapes, some others to angular shapes (e.g., the letters ዐ and መ).
- the letter ጰ has the sixth order marker (ጵ) directed to the left (e.g., fols. 38vb l.8, 39ra l.5);

- the letter የ has the left part of the sixth order (ይ) marker very short and directed downwards; its right part directed upwards (e.g., fol. 44vb l.1). The shaft of the letter is sharply slanted to the left.
- the letter የ in the fourth order (ያ) has a shaft slanted to the left, similar to some other letters (ደ).
- in the first order, the letter ደ is slanted to the left, its right leg is longer than the left one.

decoDesc.decoNote: Fol. 2r: narrow, simple, coloured (red and black) horizontal ornamental band at the bottom of the incipit page (added later?). Geometric motifs (interlaces and lines).

list.item: Fol. 1v: Unidentified quotation (?)Fol. 1v (above): ዛአ፡[sic] አንቀጽ፡ ጻ[ድ]ቃን፡ ይበውዕዋ፡ ወኃጥአን፡ የሐሥሥዋ፡ Fol. 1v (above): The righteous ones enter this gate and the sinners are looking for it. Written in a recent secondary hand (in black and red). At the bottom and at the sides, the note is surrounded by a circle of red and black dots. The form of the letter የ in in the first order, as it appears in the verb የሐሥሥዋ፡, is peculiar; the shaft which usually goes straight down from the left side of the body, starts here from the middle of it (perhaps influenced by the appearance of the letter in the main text)

Fol. 143ra(ls.1-10): Note on the commissioner and supplication prayer.Fol. 143ra (ls.1-10): ለዛቲ፡ ገድል፡ አጽሐፋ፡ ሀብተ፡ ሥላሴ፡ ተአሚኖ፡ ዓቢየ፡ ተስፋ፡ በእንተ፡ ጸሎታ፡ ለማርያም፡ ወሊዲተ፡[sic] አልፋ፡ ከመ፡ ይንሣእ፡ በረከተ፡ ሳውል፡ ወኬፋ፡ ወሊተሂ፡ ማርያም፡ ትኩኖ፡ ሓገፋ፡ ምስለ፡ ዜና፡ ገብርኤል፡ ዘጸ[ሐ]ፋ፡ ለዓለም፡ ወለዓለ[፡] ዓለም፡ አሜን። ወአሜን። Fol. 143ra (ls.1-10): The one who caused this Vita be written (is) Habtä Śǝllase, having great hope in the prayer of Mary, the Mother of Alfa, so that he might take the blessing of Saul and "Stone". And for me, and for Zena Gäbrǝʾel who wrote it (the book), she will be a protection. Forever and ever. Amen. Written in the main hand; the note mentions both the commissioner and the scribe. For Kefa (Jn. 1:43, 1 Cor. 1:12, 15:5), cp. DillmLex 876.

May it be tied in the heaven and on the earth. For eternity, amen. Written in the main hand.
- A short note, partly unreadable: ዕቀባ፡ [sic?] ሥላሴ፡ ወሐይለ፡ ሥላሴ፡ ወከፍለ፡ [n.l.]ም፡ ፍቁራንየ፡ "ʿƎquba Śǝllase and Ḥaylä Śǝllase and Kǝflä ... (are) my beloved ones"
